Fields.DialogueText: What is with this rain!? It's like it won't end!
You're overreacting. It hasn't been raining that long.
Long enough to ruin my plans. I really wanted to get some tanning in today.
I'm sure the crew will be heartbroken.
Don't mess with me, Capitaine. I'm not in the mood.

Fields.MenuText: Does the rain really drag you down that much?
Fine. I'll give you some space.
Is there any way I can help you?

Fields.DialogueText: Ya, it does! You can't do anything in the rain, and staying indoors isn't my idea of fun.
Nann, you don't have to go. I mean, I hate the rain, but it's not your fault. I shouldn't take it out on you.
Only if you can secretly control the weather.
Hey, I think I can see a break in the clouds in that direction. Maybe you'll still find time to tan after all.
Maybe, but we'd have to take care of the Morganas over there first.
So the options are fight some Morganas or stay in the rain.
Fight some Morganas it is.
@BATTLE
Audacieux, you're not tanning? I thought you'd be taking advantage of the sun.
You're late. I already got my tan in. Now I'm ready to really start my busy day!
Busy day, huh? Doing what, exactly?
Oh, a lot of stuff. All of which I'm going to need your clothes for.

Fields.MenuText: Should I just take them off right here?
My clothes? I'm going to need a bit more of an explanation.
What's wrong with your clothes?

Fields.DialogueText: I was actually thinking I'd borrow some from your room, but that would work too.
If I had time to explain, I would, but just give me your clothes already!
They're not yours, duh. I specifically need yours if my plan's going to work.
If you don't tell me what you're planning, you're not getting your hands on my clothes.
What's the big deal? Do you need some collateral or something? Here, this should do.
Audacieux! Put your shirt back on!
*ALARM*
Oh, look at that. I guess this will have to wait. Can I get my shirt back?
Please.
@BATTLE
These Morganas are not as ferocious as our last.
@BATTLE
Audacieux, I brought you a spare uniform for... whatever it is that you're planning.
You're way too late. I've moved on, since you were being so stingy.
I wasn't being stingy, I just wanted to know why you needed it. Speaking of, can you tell me now?
I was thinking about adding a little more authoritative flair to my outfit. Who has more authority than a captain on their ship?
You were trying to gain more authority by wearing my clothes? Why?
Who doesn't like being listened to? Anyway, I figured just raising my voice would have a similar effect.
I mean...
Besides, your uniform wouldn't really go with my fashion sense. I mean, look at it! It's so not me.

Fields.MenuText: You mean because they're actually clothes? You have a point.
Your fashion sense is a little outrageous. You certainly wear less than other people on the ship.
I wouldn't exactly wear your clothes to Sunday school.

Fields.DialogueText: I wear clothes! Most of the time, in fact.
Well, it's really hot. I don't understand how everyone isn't melting on this ship sometimes. The way I dress is far more comfortable.
Sunday school? I can't think of anything else I'd rather do less than that.
Here, just take the uniform in case you need it. I mean, the rules on Belle dress are so loose I don't think anyone in Command will bat an eye.
Okay, if it'll make you happy. I might be able to do something with it if I make a few... alterations.
No reason to let our guard down.
Now, crew, we have to be vigilant. The Morganas would love nothing more than to catch us unaware. So always stay alert. Understood? Then let's move!
Excellent speech, Audacieux. I think that mirror is really primed to fight some Morganas.
Oh, Capitaine! Give me a moment to change...
Well, these are my quarters. I was just surprised to see you in here practicing speeches. In my uniform.
It's the one you gave me. Did you like the changes I made?

Fields.MenuText: You certainly made it more eye-catching.
It's perfect for you, but I probably wouldn't be able to pull it off.
A little skimpy for my tastes.

Fields.DialogueText: This is the kind of captain that no one would be able to take their eyes off.
I don't think that's true. I think you'd look pretty good in this. Maybe you can try it on next.
Pft! You just don't understand fashion. This looks good.
Clothes aside, is there a reason you can't practice your speeches in your own room?
Well, I wanted to feel more like a captain. So where better to practice than the Captain's quarters?
You planning on taking my job, Audacieux?
Nann, not planning. It's more like preparing.
Mhmmmm. Well, your time should be better spent preparing for battle. We're approaching some Morganas.
Aren't we always?
@BATTLE
Ah! There we go. I was surprised to see you here.
They must have been training! This is the trickiest bunch of Morganas so far!
Stupid, stupid, stupid!
Audacieux? I could hear you all the way from my office. What's going on?
It's nothing! I don't want to talk about it.
Really? It's not like you to keep your opinions to yourself.
I'm just having a really off day. That fight took far too long. I should've been able to swat those Morganas away like flies!

Fields.MenuText: I'm not going to lie. That was a pretty poor showing coming from you.
You did fine. Those Morganas were tougher than we expected, is all.
That didn't seem any different from any of your other fights, Audacieux.

Fields.DialogueText: Ya, ya! I know! I already feel bad enough, Capitaine! You don't have to pile it on...
They weren't tougher than we expected. There wasn't anything special about them. I'm just weaker than I expected...
Oh, great! So, I'm always this crappy!? That explains it! Thanks a lot, Capitaine!
Okay, look, we all have bad days sometimes. The important thing is what you're going to do next.
Probably stomp and pout a lot more.
And then after that?
... Dust myself off and get back into the fight, right?
Exactly. Now, I'll leave you to your stomping and shouting, but when you need to talk again, you know where to find me.
...Trugarez. I'm glad to know you're here for me.
Of course I am. Have fun.
Stupid, dumb, idiot!
I'm going to be hearing that for a while, aren't I?
Brute force, Audacieux. We'll crush their devious plans.
@BATTLE
Audacieux, we've been assigned to deal with some Morganas.
Isn't that what we do every day?
Not like this. It's been described to me a "Morgana migration." A massive fleet came out of the Indian Ocean. battered Réunion Island, worked their way south, and around to the Atlantic.
Ya! So, to sum up, they've got some super dangerous Morganas that only the best could take care of. The best, of course, being moi.

Fields.MenuText: Or we were just the closest.
That's probably it.
I didn't realize your head was getting so big lately.

Fields.DialogueText: We can be both the closest and the best, Capitaine.
It's definitely it! I mean, everyone should know by now how amazing I... I mean, we are.
This is more than ego, Capitaine. I'm the best, and I dare you to prove otherwise.
Don't worry. With my speed this shouldn't take too long.
I'm glad you're confident. Intel says they'll be approaching our location before long. There's too many to take at one time, so we'll be relying on your agility.
... You're sucking the fun out of all this, Capitaine.
*ALARM*
Looks like your ambush plan has been ruined before it even started.
No, this is too soon. It must just be some wandering Morganas.
Good practice, then. Let's go!
@BATTLE
They rampaged up the west African coast, kept going, and raided targets all along the Bay of Biscay - and now, apparently, they're on their way back.
If they're supplying a building project somewhere in the Indian Ocean or the Pacific, we want it stopped. If they were just battering our morale, we want to discourage future efforts.
It's not going to be easy. It's not going to be anything close to easy.
Ambushes where we can manage them.  Luring smaller groups away from the larger pack and taking them apart piece by piece. We do it methodically, and we do it smart.
The Morganas will be here, here, and here.
That's a hell of a lot of Morganas!
Yes, but there's no need to shout, Audacieux.
From the looks of this map, this could very well be our end. And I want to make sure my last words are heard!

Fields.MenuText: Take a breath. We know what we're doing.
There are a lot of Morganas, but we've faced worse odds.
Come on, Audacieux, we don't need you frightening the crew.

Fields.DialogueText: We're sitting around waiting for mega-fleets to sneak up and blow us up!
Sounds like someone who has a habit of getting into these situations.
I'm not trying to frighten anyone, but they should know what we're dealing with.
Audacieux, you're being dramatic. That's the last thing we need right now.
Nann - I mean, ya, I agree. What we need is to take the fight to them now! Make the most of my speed! Fight on our timetable, not theirs!
Not every fight is won with speed, Audacieux. I know that's your strength, but sometimes you need patience.
*ALARM*
Oh, look at that. I guess the Morganas were getting impatient too.
This definitely isn't the main force, but we should dispatch them now before more get here.
@BATTLE
We're not engaging them all at once, remember?
We don't *want* to engage them all at once. It doesn't mean we won't.
What happened to the whole "the best, c'est moi" approach?
That map happened!
Oh - that's where this is going.
Are we sure that drawing them out is the right tactic here, Capitaine? I mean, we'd be able to do a lot of damage with the element of surprise on our side.
They have the numbers. If we can lure them to the strait, we can take them out in smaller squads.
Ya. All right, that makes sense. But can't we lure them here after we surprise them with a sneak attack?
We'd be opening ourselves to a counterattack from the whole damn armada. Dividing and conquering is the safest option.
It's like you're not even listening to me!

Fields.MenuText: How could anyone not hear you when you're shouting and stomping like that?
Okay, do you want to go over your plan one more time?
I am. It's just that your plan wouldn't work.

Fields.DialogueText: You seem to be finding some way to block me out.
Ugh, what's the point? You'd just shoot me down again.
You can't know that if you don't try. I think it'd definitely work.
I think you're getting a little upset. It might be a good time to take a break.
Maybe you're right. I could really use some time in the sun right about now.
*ALARM*
Never mind. We know what that sound means.
They're mobilizing already? I really hope this plan of yours is as good as you seem to think it is, Capitaine.
Yeah, me too.
@BATTLE
This can't be the main force. They're testing us, I think.
@BATTLE
Capitaine, the rest of the Morganas seem to be heading further out into the Atlantic - like they're running from us.
Yeah - but we've seen this kind of behavior before, and it doesn't last. Morganas aren't ones for leaving behind what they see as prey.
So we should do this my way and rush in to finish them off!
Nope. If they're moving away from land and civilian transport routes, they're going to exhaust their fuel supplies - and that'll separate the smaller ships from the bigger ones. We need to be smart.
But this is stupid! We're moving too slowly. They're going to figure out what we're doing and find another way to attack.
This whole war could've been over and done with yesterday if there were more capitaines like me!

Fields.MenuText: If there were more captains like you, we'd have more destroyed ships.
If the Morganas actually change tactics, then so will we.
We might need to come up with another plan, but I'm still not sure about yours.

Fields.DialogueText: Ya! Destroyed Morgana ships!
That's going to be too late. We need to move before the Morganas see us coming!
It would work, Capitaine! You know I'm fast enough to take them all down before they know what's going on!
... Okay. Let's round up the regulars for a strategy meeting. Maybe it *is* time to mix things up a bit.
Ya! Finally! This time you're going to listen to me!
Hey, I always listen.
Then we'll pass, won't we?
Of course we will! The real test is not becoming complacent.
Ya, ya, ya, fine! But this time maybe you'll actually do what I want!
Maybe.
I can't believe you made us waste so much time talking about my plan! Gah!
Yeah. It wasn't actually a plan at the start, Audacieux - it was an impulse. We needed the strategy meeting, we needed to bring in the other officers. I think you know that, even if you hate it.
My butt wasn't made for this much sitting.
I'm reasonably sure your butt will recover in the fullness of time.
So... we're doing it, right? After all the yakking?
Running in there and striking before they know what's happening?
Ya! That!

Fields.MenuText: It's dangerous, but it is unexpected. It could work.
You know my reservations - it's risky. We don't really know their numbers at this point.
You sure you're fit for this? You'll take a beating if we do it.

Fields.DialogueText: It will work! I have destroyed my fair share of Morganas, after all.
Maybe if we sit here for a few days, and think really hard, we'll come up with something better, but by then they'll have thought of something too. We need to strike now!
Trust me, Capitaine.
It's a risk, a big risk. But we need to take out these Morganas, right?
... Agreed. Let's do it.
Great! Now go give the orders to the crew!
You know... I think you should deliver the briefing, Audacieux. It's your plan, and I know you've been practicing your speeches.
Really, Capitaine?
Well-
Nann, nann! You already said I could!
Attention, crew! We have a new plan of attack!
I just hope this actually works.
@BATTLE
That last engagement really was good work, Audacieux. They didn't see it coming at all.
I'm still shocked you ever had any doubts.
You're getting a little fidgety there. Are you tense? Nervous?
Nann, it's not that, Capitaine. It's... The danger has passed, and the risk has paid off, but I'm still so full of energy! I can't wait for the next battle. Is that weird?

Fields.MenuText: No, not at all. We just successfully pulled off an operation. It's okay to feel good about that.
Sounds like someone's in a hurry to get to the next skirmish.
A little. I'm not quite sure I understand.

Fields.DialogueText: Exactly! Now we need to keep this good fortune going and move onto the next operation.
Well, the fight isn't over, right? There's always another Morgana to fight.
Hmmm... it's kind of like the little giddy feeling you get when you get good news. You just want to hear more good news.
Well, I'm glad to see you in good spirits. It's a welcome change from your usual combative nature.
Oh, a welcome change? If you don't want me to speak my mind, you could just always order me to keep my mouth shut.
That's not what I meant, and we both know that wouldn't work.
Damn straight that wouldn't work. If you wanted a wallflower Belle without a mind of her own, you're going to be disappointed.
That's the Audacieux I know. Let's just try and keep some of that energy for the Morganas. We hurt the armada and got away, but we're still outnumbered.
And there are some approaching as we speak.
No surprise. Let's go.
@BATTLE
Hm.
Dang it, the Morganas seem to be scattering. It won't be easy tracking them down like this.
I know. The main engagement has been successful, but... yeah, there's a lot of cleanup to be done.
We weren't even able to wipe out half of the Morganas. Our assignment was to wipe them all out. Doesn't feel like a success to me.

Fields.MenuText: It might take a little longer, but we'll get them all eventually.
They wanted the horde destroyed. You said they were scattering, right? Doesn't sound like a horde anymore to me.
You're not wrong, but you're being too hard on yourself.

Fields.DialogueText: Eventually, huh? If we take too long they'll only come back stronger than ever. That's how Morganas work!
What if they all scatter and each small group grows, and then we just helped make a bunch of hordes. See? We screwed up!
I just pushed us out of the pan and into the fire.
We probably would've been better off if we'd just stuck to your original plan, Capitaine. They probably would've turned on each other for fuel by now.
Or else they would've stopped chasing us and moved en masse to demolish West Africa. We can't know, Audacieux - we can only look forward.
So what do you suggest we do, then?
The closest of the Morganas that scattered - we need to catch up and destroy them.
I suppose that would make me feel a little better.
@BATTLE
There they are, Capitaine. We've caught up to some of the fleeing Morganas.
Let's make this fast so we can move on to the next group.
*BOOM*
What the hell was that?
Ne gomprenan ket! They're not part of the original armada - Command hasn't been tracking them!

Fields.MenuText: How did we miss this?
Let's reduce those unknowns. Can you sense how many Morganas we're talking about here?
Sum it up for me. How bad is it?

Fields.DialogueText: I don't know! They're just not supposed to be out here!
Too many. It looks like what remains of the horde we were sent to deal with.
Bad. We're seriously about to be surrounded.
Right. We need to get out of here before any more reinforcements arrive - and I really want to know what the hell is going on.
Damn it. I want to argue, but you're right. There's too many of them coming.
Right. Aim for that cluster to the west - if we can fight our way through that group and keep our engines intact, we should have some space on the other side.
Speed won't be a problem.
@BATTLE
So, unknown numbers of unknown reinforcements? Great.
As long as we're quick about it, anyway.
This is going to get messier than I ever anticipated.
We never should've been in this situation to start with. I made the wrong call.
@BATTLE
Right. Is the main group still chasing us?
Nann. Actually, it seems like the group is heading in the opposite direction from us.
The Morganas must have a bigger target in mind than us.
We need to collect ourselves and come up with another plan of attack before we rush in there again.
But if we don't stop them they'll attack something else. We need to hurry and stop them.
If we don't recover first, we'll only slow them down. I'd rather stop them in their tracks.
I wish you'd stop making such good points.
Stop. You couldn't have known about this second fleet - and, anyway, there's nothing to do now but fight. I know you're prepared for that.

Fields.MenuText: More surprises.
Back north? Dammit.
I'm not going to pretend I'm not grateful for a chance to breathe.

Fields.DialogueText: But still...
Audacieux, what's wrong?
That Morgana horde we let get away? It all but leveled Lüderitz. We're to blame for all the casualties there.

Fields.MenuText: If anyone is to blame, it's me. I made the call.
This is war. People die. Sometimes innocent people.
Blame the Morganas. They did this, not you.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not going to blame you, Capitaine...
They shouldn't, though. We should be able to protect them.
I know the Morganas are to blame. I know they're the real monsters. It's just sometimes easier to blame yourself.
You're being too hard on yourself, Audacieux. This isn't like you.
... You know why I dress the way I do, Capitaine?
You mean when you're tanning or just your "normal" attire?
Very funny. I dress the way I do because I enjoy standing out and being the center of attention.
Okay, I kind of knew both those things. What's your point?
My point is this: I am the face of all we do. All our victories, all our failures. When people remember me, they should know that I made it safe for them to remember.

Fields.MenuText: I know. I feel the same way.

Fields.DialogueText: You don't know that!
Even if we had jumped back into battle, we would've been fighting their rear guard - and we probably would've lost. We wouldn't have gotten out in front of the group hitting the coast.
Or we could've beat the rear guard and then the guys in front would've turned around and we'd've gotten them too!
No. I don't know, maybe we would've survived a second engagement, but there was no stopping the front group in time. We just weren't going to be close enough.
Grrr... I... I think I need to take some anger out.
I understand. Just know I'm here for you, okay?
Mhmmmm.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*

Fields.MenuText: I get it - but we couldn't have stopped them in time.

Fields.DialogueText: But, realistically-
What do you need, Audacieux?
Capitaine, I've been thinking. I won't feel any better until we destroy every single one of these Morganas.

Fields.MenuText: You mean all over the world? Because that's a tall order.
I feel the same way. They need to pay.
Okay. Have you given any thought to-

Fields.DialogueText: Eventually, but right now I'm just talking about the ones we let get away.
Exactly!
What do you think I've been doing this whole time? Thinking! Too much!
Heh. If you're sure about this, I'd be a pretty horrible captain to say no.
Especially since it's still our mission.
Let's pretend I'm mostly doing it for you.
Sure you are. So where are the Morganas now?
*ALARM*
It's not like we weren't already hunting, Audacieux.
@BATTLE
Yeah, well - we need to find them first. We're not talking about a unified fleet heading for the Indian Ocean anymore, as far as I can tell.
I think their fuel problems finally caught up with them, and ransacking Lüderitz didn't give them the oil they needed.
Apparently, some of them fired on one another, and the group has split up. Maybe they'll come to their senses and merge again, or maybe they'll all go back to smaller-scale piracy.
Ya - or maybe if we hunt down enough of them, the rest will band together to come after us!
Have we found them yet? A really big group, I mean?
It's going to take longer than that, Audacieux. These things can take time.
We don't have time! What if they decide to attack somewhere else?

Fields.MenuText: Then we'll know where they are.
They won't. We'll stop them this time.
Is the idea that people die during war just hitting you now?

Fields.DialogueText: This is no time to be trying to look at the silver lining!
Damn right we will!
I'm not an idiot, but if we can do something to save people, we should!
Intelligence gathering takes time. As much as you might not like it, you're going to need to be patient.
... Fine. Is there at least something I can do to help?
Just keep your feelers out. You're the best tool we have for finding Morganas.
Oh, I'm a tool now?
You know what I mean.
Ya, ya. I do, and I will. If that horde messes up and gets too close to us, I will sense them.
@BATTLE
Achoo!
Capitaine? Are you getting sick?
No, it's probably just allergies or something.
You can't be getting sick when we're running toward the worst horde of Morganas we've ever faced.
I'm not getting sick, and we've faced way more dangerous Morganas before.
Here, take this. It'll clear your system of any illnesses.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not getting sick!
Mmmm, smells fruity.
You just happen to carry medicine around with you?

Fields.DialogueText: Not after you take this.
It should - I mixed it with some juice. It's easier to swallow this way.
Of course! I don't want to get sick either.
Before I drink anything, I'd like to know what this actually is.
It's my own personal remedy. I take a shot of it every morning, to make sure I stay safe and healthy.
You take a shot of this every morning? That doesn't seem safe.
It's perfectly safe. I haven't so much as sneezed in weeks. Now, it's time to take your medicine, Capitaine.
*ALARM*
Oh, look at that. We've got company.
Better swallow fast, then. Otherwise you're not leaving this room. We can't have you infecting the rest of the crew.
... Fine.
@BATTLE
Audacieux! We've found a major cluster of them.
Where? How? Did they attack again?
They almost took out a patrol ship - but they weren't able to keep up the chase. Our side escaped mostly unscathed, and now we have our targets' location.
Nothing but good news then. Let's get going!
You're confident you can handle them?
Of course! Aren't you?

Fields.MenuText: You're kidding, right?
Of course. We're going to send them all to the bottom of the ocean.
Just checking on you. I know you were a little shaken up before.

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! We can do this!
Have you been reading my diary? Because that's exactly what I was planning.
I wasn't shaken up! I was... I was anxious to finish the fight! We need to finish this fight!
How long before we reach them?
Not long, so we don't have all that much time to come up with a plan.
I know what I want to do, but I guess I can listen to your ideas on the matter.
@BATTLE
You have a diary?
Shut up!
We're going to be face to face with the enemy soon, Audacieux - and there are some indications their numbers are growing again. We need to agree on a plan.
Fast and dirty. Take them down before they know it. Just like before.
Last time, we were surprising them with the direct approach. It's less of a surprise if you do the same thing twice.
Ya, ya. There were more of them than there are now. We just need to keep going until the last Morgana is defeated. That's how we win.

Fields.MenuText: I was thinking more about coordinating specific tactics with our allies. Y'know, actual planning.
A speech for the ages.
Yeah, okay. Fair enough.

Fields.DialogueText: This is enough of a plan! It's math. Simple math. They did teach you how to add and subtract, right?
Shut up!
I knew you'd listen to reason eventually!
Right. I'm still not sure this deserves to be called a plan...
But?
But it's all we've got, and we're about to engage.
You won't regret this, Capitaine.
I haven't given the order yet.
But you will, and you won't regret it when you do.
Now let's go! We have a horde to sink!
@BATTLE
All right, that's a few down. Only a whole bunch left to go.
We're really going to keep fighting?
And this was the "plan" you you were pushing for, right? Relentless, messy brawling?
Ya - but, honestly, I wasn't actually sure you'd trust my instincts.

Fields.MenuText: It's the only plan we've got.
It's a good plan, and you have good instincts.
Trust is a strong word.

Fields.DialogueText: It's a little disheartening when you say it like that, Capitaine.
I know, I keep telling people that!
You can't take it back now. Now I know you trust me!
*BOOM*
Even if we wanted to get away, it doesn't look like the Morganas are about to let us.
That's fine by me. Let's make them run instead.
Nann, wait - I take that back! We just can't let them get away again!
I know. Don't worry, they won't.
@BATTLE
We're leaving salvage to attract starving Morganas, and they have to assume we're weakening ourselves. As bait goes, it's not bad.
This looks like the last of them, Capitaine.
That would explain why a few of them seem to be turning tail.
Cowards! They know we're about to wipe them out!
Think you can move fast enough to destroy them all before they get out of range?
Who do you think you're talking to? They're not going to outrun me.

Fields.MenuText: Just double checking.
Oh, I'm confident. I'm just making sure you are.
I'm not sure... Morganas can be pretty fast.

Fields.DialogueText: You should know me by now. You don't even have to check once.
When am I not? I'm the most confident Belle in the fleet.
I see what you're doing, Capitaine, and it's working.
I'd hold onto something if I were you, Capitaine. This might get a little bumpy.
@BATTLE
You did it, Audacieux. The entire horde - gone. They never made it anywhere near the Indian Ocean.
But, as to us trashing the enemy - did you really ever have any doubts?

Fields.MenuText: After our first encounter with them? Yeah.
It was really risky. I thought we were dead for sure.
Not a one. I've got faith in you.

Fields.DialogueText: That was a fluke. Clearly. My tactic worked this time after all.
Seriously? You thought we could've died? Why didn't you say that earlier!?
Well, that's... Tragurez, Capitaine. Does this mean you'll start listening to all my ideas?
Listen? Sure. Doesn't mean I'll do anything with them.
Feels good to have a few less Morganas on the ocean, right?
Ya, it really does, but there's still more out there. We can't rest easy just yet.
We can at least catch our breath.
Fine, but you should know there are a few Morganas moving south. They're close now, but who knows where they'll be after all this breathing.
I thought we destroyed all the Morganas in the horde?
No, these Morganas aren't from the horde. They're just nearby. There's always another battle to win.
You can be a little singleminded, can't you? You win. Let's go take care of some more Morganas.
I knew you'd see things my way.
@BATTLE
I hope the survivors in Lüderitz can take some comfort from that.
Ya. I hope so too.
It feels like forever since I've been able to just relax like this.
I figured some sun tanning would be the perfect thing to distract you from leading us into more skirmishes.
You know me well.
Better than I'd like since you keep taking off your clothes.
We've gone over this, Capitaine. And besides, look at you, you're hardly blushing anymore.

Fields.MenuText: Oh, I'm definitely still blushing, I don't think I'll ever be able to not.
It's nothing I haven't seen before.
I'm just treating you like an eclipse. Trying not to look directly at you.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, you sure know how to flatter a girl.
I suppose at a certain point it'd be more shocking if I actually wore a swimming suit.
Your loss. More for the rest of the crew to enjoy.
Capitaine, we don't have another mission just yet, do we?
Not yet. You're no longer in a hurry to get some hard-earned glory in battle?
Heh, nann. It's not like it's going anywhere. This beautiful weather, on the other hand, isn't going to last.
You're not wrong.
*ALARM*
And I was just starting to get some color!
The Morganas are always there. Even when you're not looking for them.
I know! I hate them!
@BATTLE
Audacieux, I need your help...
Capitaine, what... oh. You do not look good.
I, uh... I think I got sick...
What did I tell you? I knew you were getting sick! You should've listened to me.

Fields.MenuText: I wasn't getting sick. This is a... new, different sickness.
You're right. I should've listened to you.
We were in the middle of chasing down a horde. I didn't have time.

Fields.DialogueText: Mhmmm? Sure it was. I totally believe that obvious lie.
That's what I like to hear. When will you realize I'm almost always right?
You know what that sounds like? A whole lot of excuses.
You should've taken my tonic when I offered it to you. This all could've been avoided.
That's why I'm coming to you now. I'm hoping you still have some I could take.
Oh, no, it's too late for that. That was to prevent illness. You're already sick. You need something to make you healthy again.
Do you have something that can do that?
I do, but you're not going to like it.
Ugh, what is that horrible smell?
That's the smell of good health. Now pinch your nose and swallow this down!
*ALARM*
I think I'd rather face the Morganas.
I'm not letting you get away from me this time. I'm doing this because I care about you and the well-being of everyone on this ship! Now, drink it and feel better!
After the battle, I promise!
Stop running from me!
@BATTLE
Well done, Capitaine! Now let me just see what state my hull is in and...
*ahem*
... Merde. Fine. But if it tastes as bad as it smells I may get sick again just from losing my will to live.
You? Never.
Eugh. You know me too well.
